ARTICLE.TITLE: Brothers John and David Martin, of Car Colston, at centre of High Court battle over family land
ARTICLE.TEXT:
Two brothers from one of Nottinghamshire’s oldest farming families who are at loggerheads over the future of land which one of them says has been in the family for six centuries have been at the centre of a bitter High Court battle.

Now a judge at the court in London has ruled that five of the seven parcels of the land at Car Colston – which have an offer of £845,00 on them – should be sold.

In his judgment running to nearly 5,000 words Master Shuman, a procedural judge at the courts, said it was a “sad family case” in which the relationship between brothers, John and David Martin broke down in or about 2005.
